titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the first half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) The Sǝnkǝssar for the first half of the year (fols. 4ra-191rc) I-1) Mäskäräm (fols. 4ra-39vc) I-2) Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 39va-66vb) I-3) Ḫǝdar (fols. 67ra-92vc) - Zä-ʾaqräbku maḫletä… “The song I am offering…” (concluding prayer): fol. 92vb-92vc I-4) Taḫśaś (fols. 93ra-124rc) I-5) Ṭǝrr (fols. 124va-164vc) I-6) Yäkkatit (fols. 165ra-191rc) The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns
Colophon.

copyists.copyist: Ṣägga Zä-ʾAb is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formula on fols. 39vb and 191rb.

donors.donor: The "people and children of Däbrä Zäyt" (Ḥǝzb/ däqiqä däbrä zäyt) are mentioned in the supplication formulas of the Ms. Also abunä Gäbrä Krǝstos and abunä Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer are mentioned in the supplication formula on fol 191rb.

dcomments.dcomment: According to the colophon the Ms. was finished in 1922 year of God (meant "year of mercy" = 1929/30 A.D.).

txstates.txstate: Holes and tears are repaired, often the stitching is marked with lines in red or black ink (rarely modern pen), e.g., fols. 18, 60vc, 61rc, 76, 92vc, 120. Stains from the red ink were encircled with black lines on fol. 44v.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornaments on the leather cover (at least 8 tools were used: triple line fillet, double line fillet, cross hatching, double sine wave with dots, criss-cross, double circle, dot fillet, small x).

bnothers.bnother: Two rows of endband stitches through the spine cover.

inks.ink: Black, red (vivid scarlet, fols. 1-29v; vivid red fols. 30r-191r).

squires.squire: A(3; s.l.: 3, stub before 1/fols. 1r-3v) – I(10/fols. 4r-13v) – ፪II(8/fols. 14r-21v) – ፪III(8/fols. 22r-29v) – IV(8/fols. 30r-37v) – V(8/fols. 38r-45v) – VI(9; s.l.: 8, stub after 1/fols. 64r-54v) – VII(8/fols. 55r-62v) – VIII(4/fols. 63r-66v) – IX(7; s.l.: 3, stub after 5 /fols. 67r-72v) – X(4/fols. 73r-77v) – XI(9; s.l.:3, stub after 6/fols. 78r-86v) – XII(8/fols. 87r-94v) – XIII(8/fols. 95r-102v) – XIV(7; s.l. 2, stub after 5; 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 1/fols. 103r-109v) – XV(8/fols. 110r-117v) – XVI(8; s.l.: 4, stub after 6/fols. 118r-126v) – XVII(8/fols. 127r-134v) – XVIII(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 2; 6, stub after 2/fols. 135r-142v) – XIX(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 8; 8, stub after 3 /fols. 143r-152v) – XX(8; s.l. 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 153r-160v) – XXI(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 6; 7, stub after 1/fols. 161r-168v) – XXII(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 169r-177v) – XXIII(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 5; 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 1/fols. 178r-184v) – XXIV(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 5/fols. 185r-191v) – B(3; s.l.: 1, stub after 3/fols. 192r-194v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1E-1E-1E1E-1E1E/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is irregular at times creating the impression that more than one scribe was involved (e.g., fol.60ra). Characteristic letters of this scribe are (s. for example fol. 6r): - variants of the letters የ, ፀ and ዐ with a large body - ዋ and ዊ with a very long leg and very small body - vowel loops are closed with a very thin line and are sometimes not closed at all, such as, ግ, ቶ, ሎ

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the scribe’s name; the word sälam (sometimes only the first two letters); the word zäyt, in Däbrä Zäyt; several lines or groups of lines on the page opening the commemorative notices for each month; one or two initial lines of each commemorative notice; elements of the punctuation signs (e.g., nine dot asterisks in red and black, separating the commemorative notices); elements of Ethiopic numerals; the names of the months in the upper margin.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The scribe wrote directives for the ministers, fol. 92vc: ወለለፍጻሜሁ፡ ጊዜ፡ ታነብብ፡ ዘአቅረብኩ፡ በል፨ “In the time when you have finished reading say Zä-ʾaqräbku”. Meaning the concluding prayer Zä-ʾaqräbku maḫletä… “The song I am offering…”.

colophon.det: The colophon states that the writing of this Synaxarion was finished on Tuesday, in the evening hour in the "year of God" 1922 (ʿAmätä ʿAmlak "Year of God" meaning ʿAmätä mǝḥrät "Year of mercy").

extras.extra: - Supplication formulas are dedicated to: a) ኵልነ፡ ሕዝበ፡ ክርስቲያን "all Christian people" (e.g., fols. 10va, 14vc, 25vb); or b) ኵልነ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ደብረ፡ ዘይት "all the children of Däbrä Zäyt" (e.g., fols. 12va, 14c, 19vb, 37ra) - Several interlineal or marginal corrections: fols, 7vb, 44vb, 78r, 134r, 152rb. - Names of the months are written in red or black ink on almost all fols. opening a new quire. - Several short notes and pen trails are written in ink: fols. 1r, 2v, 95v, 96r, 98r, 193v, 194r, 194v. - A phrase, ይቤሎሙ፡ ገብረ፡ እግዚእ፡ ለየማነ፡ ብርሃን፡ ወርቅ፡ ጊዜ፡ ጸዓተ፡ ሞት[፡] መከራ።(?) is written in black ink, by a fine (secondary) hand on fol. 2r. The words መልጕም፡ ብሂል፡ ፈረስ are written by the same hand on fol. 2v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: The numeral ፪ is written on fols. 14r, 22r.

frames.frame:
- Fol. 4r (incipit of the reading for the month Mäskäräm): crude coloured (red, purple, yellow) ornamental band; interlaces and anthropomorphic motifs.
- Small (sometimes coloured: red, black, yellow, purple) ornamental elements; geometric motifs. As text dividers or in the upper margins on fols.: 48r, 49v, 50r 53r, 66r, 67r, 71r, 73v, 82v, 92v, 93r, 100r, 100v, 108r, 120v, 133r, 150r.
